result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Charles Bunker Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Withheld; 3 years probation; conditions of probation; fine/costs totaling $528.00; Restitution $1,270.00 plus surcharges to be paid to Todd J. Van Roo; AODA treatment & follow-thru (05-29-2015); No contact with Todd J. Van Room or his residence 10091 W. Campfire Circle; DNA sample & surcharge.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$1,270.00 plus surcharges   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$250.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
NO CONTACT with Todd J. Van Roo or his residence at 10091 W. Campfire Cricle.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations (05-29-2015).

Van Roo; AODA treatment & follow-thru (05-29-2015); No contact with Todd J. Van Room or his residence 10091 W. Campfire Circle; DNA sample & surcharge.  Forward bond to DOC

Defendant Ryan Charles Bunker in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ack. receipt of Information.  Joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; advised of rights; Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 1; PSI waived; bail continues until sentencing. Plea questionnaire filed. Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
